title: Delhi-NCR get relief as CAQM withdraws GRAP 4
summary: Delhi-NCR sees Stage 4 GRAP revoked as pollution eases, but authorities face sharp criticism for enforcement failures. Significant shortfalls in construction site inspections and mechanical road sweeping were noted across Delhi and neighboring NCR states, undermining efforts during the toughest pollution phases.   Why IndiGo got away with peanuts penalty after causing misery Can this IPO-bound company step out of Flipkart’s shadow? For a future, Hindustan Copper is reviving what it junked in past RBI is easing, but India’s long-term rates tell a different story Stock Radar: SBI hits fresh reco
full_text:
Delhi-NCR sees Stage 4 GRAP revoked as pollution eases, but authorities face sharp criticism for enforcement failures. title: 'Reduce customs duty slabs in Budget 2026'
summary: India's customs duty structure needs simplification. The Global Trade Research Initiative suggests reducing the actual number of duty slabs, not just basic customs duty rates. This reform aims to boost ease of doing business. Current complexities hinder manufacturing and exports. Simplifying tariffs and processes is crucial for economic growth and competitiveness.   Why IndiGo got away with peanuts penalty after causing misery Can this IPO-bound company step out of Flipkart’s shadow? For a future, Hindustan Copper is reviving what it junked in past RBI is easing, but India’s long-term rates te

title: Execution key for defence stocks: Amit Anwani
summary: India’s defence spending may not rise sharply as a share of GDP, but capital outlays are set to grow 8–10% annually, says Amit Anwani of PL Capital. Aero engines, missiles and defence electronics could benefit, while execution and order delivery will matter more than fresh allocations. Submarine orders may boost shipbuilders.  Value seen in banks, IT and FMCG, be wary on defence: Rajat Sharma Tata's defence division in talks to supply military hardware to Europe & Africa: Report Budget expectations low, says Jefferies; lists defence capex among 8 measures to watch out for (What's moving Sensex
full_text:
India’s defence spending may not rise sharply as a share of GDP, but capital outlays are set to grow 8–10% annually, says Amit Anwani of PL Capital. Aero engines, missiles and defence electronics could benefit, while execution and order delivery will matter more than fresh allocations. Submarine orders may boost shipbuilders.  Value seen in banks, IT and FMCG, be wary on defence: Rajat Sharma Tata's defence division in talks to supply military hardware to Europe & Africa: Report Budget expectations low, says Jefferies; lists defence capex among 8 measures to watch out for (What's moving Sensex and Nifty Track latest market news, stock tips, Budget 2025, Share Market on Budget 2025 and expert advice, on ETMarkets. title: Congress takes swipe at BJP over new chief
summary: Congress criticized the BJP's announcement of Nitin Nabin as president, calling it a pre-determined outcome rather than an election. Party spokesperson Pawan Khera sarcastically suggested Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar might resign due to a lack of influence. Khera also dismissed Prime Minister Modi's 'boss' comment as a political game.   Why IndiGo got away with peanuts penalty after causing misery Can this IPO-bound company step out of Flipkart’s shadow? For a future, Hindustan Copper is reviving what it junked in past RBI is easing, but India’s long-term rates tell a different st
full_text: Congress criticized the BJP's announcement of Nitin Nabin as president, calling it a pre-determined outcome rather than an election. Party spokesperson Pawan Khera sarcastically suggested Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar might resign due to a lack of influence. Khera also dismissed Prime Minister Modi's 'boss' comment as a political game. title: Trump's new US map shows Venezuela, Greenland
summary: Donald Trump shared posts on Truth Social depicting the US flag including Canada, Greenland, and Venezuela, and a milepost marking Greenland as a US Territory. title: States can probe cases against Centre staff: SC
summary: The Supreme Court has ruled that state police can investigate and file chargesheets against central government employees for bribery and corruption. No prior permission from the CBI is needed to register such cases. The court clarified that offenses under the Prevention of Corruption Act can be investigated by state or central agencies. State police can probe corruption case under PC Act against central govt employees: SC   Why IndiGo got away with peanuts penalty after causing misery Can this IPO-bound company step out of Flipkart’s shadow? title: A seat at Trump’s Gaza peace table could test India
summary: India has been invited to participate in a newly established US-led Gaza Peace Board, thrusting New Delhi into a pivotal moment in international relations. Analysts caution that becoming a board member may present substantial reputational dilemmas and strategic pitfalls. Alternatively, India can contribute to Gaza's rebuilding through existing international frameworks without the need for formal involvement. title: Tata Capital targets sub-1% credit cost
summary: Tata Capital is focusing on growth and customer affordability. The company is passing on lower funding costs to customers. Credit costs are declining and expected to go below 1% ahead of schedule. A 23-25% annual growth outlook remains intact. Operating efficiency and GenAI will drive profitability. Return on assets is projected to improve. Rajiv Sabharwal, MD & CEO of Tata Capital  Tata Capital Q3 Results: PAT jumps 17% YoY to Rs 1,257 crore, total revenue up 12% Tata Capital shares gain 2% after Q3 net profit jumps 17% YoY (What's moving Sensex and Nifty Track latest market news, stock tips,
full_text:
Tata Capital is focusing on growth and customer affordability. The company is passing on lower funding costs to customers. Credit costs are declining and expected to go below 1% ahead of schedule. A 23-25% annual growth outlook remains intact. Operating efficiency and GenAI will drive profitability. Return on assets is projected to improve. title: Ro-Ko's deals in focus as BCCI may let go Grade A+
summary: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is set to introduce a revised central contract system, under which the Grade A+ category will be discontinued. If the new model is approved by the board, Team India veterans Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are expected to be placed in Grade B, according to BCCI sources. title: Toyota Urban Cruiser launched: Check details
summary: Toyota Kirloskar Motor has launched its first electric vehicle in India, the Urban Cruiser EV. This mid-size SUV enters the mass-market electric vehicle segment. It will compete with models like the Hyundai Creta Electric and MG ZS EV. The vehicle is expected to offer two battery options and a significant driving range. An all-wheel-drive version will also be available. full_text:
Toyota Kirloskar Motor has launched its first electric vehicle in India, the Urban Cruiser EV. This mid-size SUV enters the mass-market electric vehicle segment. It will compete with models like the Hyundai Creta Electric and MG ZS EV. The vehicle is expected to offer two battery options and a significant driving range. An all-wheel-drive version will also be available. title: Satya Nadella stresses on AI adoption at Davos
summary: Artificial intelligence is no longer confined to advanced economies. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella believes AI's future depends on its spread, particularly in the Global South. He emphasizes the need for skills, capital, and policy support to translate AI into productivity and growth. Talent and technical know-how are globally distributed. The real challenge is the commitment to deploy AI at scale. Listen to this article in summarized format Unlock AI Briefing and Premium Content   Why IndiGo got away with peanuts penalty after causing misery Can this IPO-bound company step out of Flipkart’s sha
full_text:
Artificial intelligence is no longer confined to advanced economies. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella believes AI's future depends on its spread, particularly in the Global South. He emphasizes the need for skills, capital, and policy support to translate AI into productivity and growth. Talent and technical know-how are globally distributed. The real challenge is the commitment to deploy AI at scale.
